summary: Email chain between attorneys regarding the scheduling of an interview with David Rodgers, a witness in the Epstein investigation, and a specific inquiry about a flight log entry from August 1, 1997, that may be connected to a missing Florida teenager.

persons.name: Brendan Quigley
persons.context: Partner at Baker Botts L.L.P. representing David Rodgers; corresponds with prosecutors to schedule an interview and provide flight logs.

persons.name: David Rodgers
persons.context: Client of Brendan Quigley; subject of a subpoena and interview request by the SDNY regarding flight records as part of the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Andrew Lankler
persons.context: Attorney at Baker Botts L.L.P. copied on correspondence regarding the David Rodgers subpoena and interview scheduling.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Prosecutor with the Southern District of New York handling the Epstein investigation; coordinates the interview with David Rodgers and raises the issue of the flight log entry.

connections.description: Quigley is the legal representative for David Rodgers, handling subpoena compliance and interview arrangements with prosecutors.
Both are attorneys at Baker Botts L.L.P. working on the David Rodgers case, as indicated by being copied on emails.
Quigley (defense attorney) corresponds with Comey (prosecutor) to schedule witness interviews and discuss investigative matters.
Comey, as a prosecutor, seeks to interview Rodgers as a witness regarding flight records in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Interview with David Rodgers
events.description: Planned meeting between SDNY prosecutors and David Rodgers to discuss flight records related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Flight Log Entry Investigation
events.description: Prosecutors note a flight log entry from August 1, 1997, showing an individual with a name similar to a missing Florida teenager, prompting questions for David Rodgers.

events.title: Initial Flight Log Production
events.description: Brendan Quigley provides initial flight logs for David Rodgers covering January 23, 2006, to September 19, 2013, to the SDNY under confidentiality.

events.title: Additional Flight Log Production
events.description: Brendan Quigley provides additional flight logs for David Rodgers covering 1991 to January 2006 to the SDNY.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors planned to question David Rodgers about a flight log entry from August 1, 1997, that listed an individual with a name similar to a missing Florida teenager last seen around that time.
David Rodgers was treated as a witness, not a target, with the interview focused on flight records he maintained or was associated with.
The email chain reveals ongoing cooperation between defense attorneys and prosecutors, with flight logs being produced on a rolling basis from December 2019 to January 2020.
The document indicates the investigation into Epstein included scrutiny of flight logs for potential connections to missing persons cases.
Significant redactions are present in the email text, particularly around the name of the missing teenager and some prosecutor identifiers.
